result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:29 AM Defendant Christopher S Castillo Moreno in court.  Attorney John Alexander Cabranes in court for Christopher S Castillo Moreno.  Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski. 
State requests a January status date.  Drafted plea offers which parties are discussing, 38,000 pages of medical records are being reviewed and are in process of being provided to defense counsel.
Status conference scheduled for January 24, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on January 24, 2023 at 09:00 am.

8:31 AM Defendant Christopher S Castillo Moreno in court.  Attorney John Alexander Cabranes in court for Christopher S Castillo Moreno.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski. State has tendered an offer.  Parties have been negotiating.  Although, Defense could not make the meeting with the State. State does not object.
Status conference scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on November 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
for an adj.

BTC: Last status given.

Status conference on September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

The State needs to speak to the investigator before making an offer to defense.

Status conference on August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Do not drive at all. No contact with the victim K.B (person, property, residence or family).

1:45 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher S Castillo Moreno appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney John Alexander Cabranes in court for Christopher S Castillo Moreno. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. K.F appears on behalf of victim via zoom. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
